quest.name: The Last Pillar to Fall
journal: Unukalhai has a request regarding the final eikon of the Warring Triad.

Unukalhai informs you that the Scions have begun a search inside Azys Lla's research facility. They seek to locate the thralls responsible for maintaining the manifestation of the last remaining eikon of the Warring Triad, but certain sectors are too dangerous to enter for those not blessed with the Echo. Make your way to the Flagship, and wait for your comrades to arrive at the agreed rendezvous point.

After arriving on Azys Lla with Unukalhai, your fellow Scions soon join you with the disturbing news that an imperial force once more occupies the facility. As Urianger ponders the inefficacy of his wards, Regula van Hydrus approaches your party and explains the reason for the magick's failure: a pulse of power from the soon-to-awaken Zurvan. The legatus quickly describes the dire situation, and urges you to join him and his troops in preventing the Demon's thralls from rousing their master. Hurry after Unukalhai, and delve into Central Azys Lla.

You speak with Unukalhai, and he urges you to not fall behind the rest of your companions. The ritual must be stopped.

※The verification node can be used to re-enter Central Azys Lla.

You destroy the devices feeding aether to the stirring Zurvan, and return the eikon to a fitful slumber. But the temporary victory is not without a cost: in an unexpected act of heroism, Regula is struck down as he defends an overmatched Unukalhai. With his dying breath, the legatus bids you complete his duty, and slay the Demon and his followers. You withdraw with your companions, and the masked youth stands somewhat apart, shaken and disbelieving...

※The verification node can be used to re-enter Central Azys Lla.

Regula's sacrifice has afforded you the chance to strike at a weakened Zurvan. With their tasks assigned, your companions depart to secure the controls to the eikon's shackles. It falls to you and your handpicked company of warriors to bring oblivion to the Demon himself.

※Containment Bay Z1T9 can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
You have felled the monstrous Zurvan. Make your way back to the Flagship.

With the fall of Zurvan, the cataclysmic threat of the Warring Triad has at last been expunged. Even as your fellow Scions praise Regula's final heroic act, however, Unukalhai once more agonizes over his own inadequate strength. Return to the Rising Stones, and listen to the masked youth's story.

Unukalhai removes his mask, and proceeds to reveal not only his features, but also the truth behind his origins. He speaks of his birth on a different star, and of how that world became what is now known as the void. Though born with the power of the Echo, Unukalhai describes how he was yet too young to contend with the forces that brought such ruination, and of how a sudden shift in the balance between Light and Dark can consign an entire world to oblivion. His spirit snatched into the safety of the rift by his present master, Unukalhai explains that he came to Hydaelyn determined to prevent the realm from suffering a similar fate. And now that he walks alongside the Scions and the Warrior of Light, he may just yet become the hero he was destined to be.
objectives: Speak with Unukalhai in Central Azys Lla.
Confront Zurvan in Containment Bay Z1T9.
Speak with Unukalhai at the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Greetings, Warrior of Light. But one pillar of the Warring Triad remains: Zurvan, the eikon known as the “Demon.”

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: According to the histories I have uncovered, this monstrous being was worshipped by a race of Meracydian beastmen.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: These creatures are the key to maintaining Zurvan's manifestation, and we can be sure that many such thralls will be imprisoned somewhere within the research facility.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: It is imperative that we determine their exact location as swiftly as possible─we dare not risk repeating the near-disaster we suffered at the hands of Sophia's servants.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: As such, your fellow Scions have already begun an exhaustive search, but there are several sectors which only you, Krile, and I can enter without fear of enthrallment. Let us make our way to Azys Lla forthwith and aid the investigations.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Zurvan's thralls must be accounted for ere we face the eikon himself. Azys Lla awaits!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Forename, it is good we caught you! The facility has been swarmed by imperial troops!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: By their standards did we judge them soldiers of the VIth. Aye, once more doth Regula van Hydrus stretch forth his hand to seize the forbidden fruits of Allag. And once more have our meticulous wards been swept aside like so many cobwebs...

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Your meddlesome wards were destroyed from within by the pulsating energies of an eikon.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: Nay, put up your weapons and listen. The followers of Zurvan have awakened, and they toil to rouse their master!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Demon's worshipers yet slumbered when we confronted Sophia. Could the tampering of her thralls have been more widespread than we thought?

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: They shared a common enemy─'tis not unthinkable that they would seek to free all those the Allagans had imprisoned.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, the cage doors are open. And whilst you stand here quibbling over who picked the locks, my soldiers are inside the facility risking their lives and their sanity.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: They have volunteered to face death to prevent Zurvan's servants from waking him in the fullness of his power. Now, assuming you have at last understood the gravity of the situation, it is time that I rejoined them.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: But you cannot hope to succeed! The eikon will enslave the minds of any who draw near!

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: Thus did I seek out those with the power to resist his influence. Aid us, and mayhap my men will not perish in vain.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: ...You propose an alliance.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: I have delved into the depths of this place and found its technology wanting. These mechanisms have failed to hold their prisoners, and such broken artifacts are unfit to bring before the Emperor.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: Twice have you bested me in combat. Will you now lend me that strength, and stand against our mutual foe?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
'Twas in opposing your reckless schemes that Ysayle was lost to us...
You expect us to simply forgive and forget all that has come before?

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: I expect you to put aside your emotions and use your better judgment. But, of course, I am dealing with savages.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: I will not stand here and justify the death of the ice maiden. We pursued our ideals, and you pursued yours─such was the result. And mayhap you might consider another point...

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: In these endless clashes, we have all lost comrades dear to us! Yet I choose to put aside past grievances to beg your champion's aid; to appeal to your reason.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Thou art willing to build a bridge of common purpose upon such tremulous foundations?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I, too, am hesitant to accept this arrangement, Archon Y'shtola. But the offer has been made to the Warrior of Light, and 'tis herhis involvement which shall ultimately sway its outcome. I shall abide by Forename's decision.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Zurvan must be stopped.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I cannot fight alongside the Empire.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Then for better or worse, we shall fight at your side.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Mistress Krile and I are also resistant to primal influences. We shall aid you where we can.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: ...Then let us be on our way.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: ...Your answer does not surprise me. I was, however, duty-bound to pursue the most likely means of victory for the Empire. I leave you to your fate.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: ...I will go.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Whilst I cannot match Forename's strength, I am immune to primal influence. I may prove of some use to you.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I shall go as well. I fear that denying the legatus here will invite a lifetime of regret. There is too much at stake.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thus we are shown the error of our ways. I spoke of Ysayle, but she would not have approved of allowing such a horror to surface whilst we clung to old rivalries.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Indeed, she would not. There is yet time─let us hasten after our comrades.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: You struggle to accept my proposal? An understandable conflict, but I will waste no more words. The hourglass drips with the blood of my soldiers.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: ...Is it wise to refuse him? The imperials have no means to resist Zurvan's will. The eikon could soon awake in full possession of his power...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I never imagined I'd suggest joining hands with the imperials, but I see no alternative. The consequences of inaction are too dire to contemplate.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: And how rare this moment, when the Empire opposeth us not...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Let us then hasten after the legatus and accept his offer. The Twelve forbid we be foolish enough to allow old grudges pave the way for Zurvan's resurrection.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Our companions have already passed through to the research facility. We should not lag behind!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Demon stirs...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Like a suckling babe, he feedeth upon the aether siphoned unto him by his thralls. We must needs deprive him of this sustenance!

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: Then we destroy those devices.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Hold! Witness your soldiers!

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: They have turned one against the other. Even half awake, Zurvan corrupts and converts those who enter his aura...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The three of us, then. Forename, Unukalhai: we rush in together and each disable a generator. We cannot give them the chance to rally a defense!

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: There are four mechanisms by my count. If I can avoid the eikon's miasma, my blade will make short work of the last one.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: We, all of us, have pledged our lives to─

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: Keep your lives. I would rather you tend to my fallen─some may yet survive with their minds intact.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: I know not if my strength will be enough. I am no champion...

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: The battlefield is no place for uncertainty, boy. Fate has blessed you with a unique talent and an occasion to use it. Do not waste such a gift.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: We strike!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Gods, Zurvan is─!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Unukalhai!

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: Raaargh!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: He slumbers once more...

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: ...You saved me. Why?

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: I told you, boy... Yours is a gift too precious to waste. A gift the Emperor may one day have need of in his war upon these untamable eikons...

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: Emperor Varis, he... He raised me up from the ranks, stood against my detractors... I gladly give my life in his service...

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: <cough> You must... You must finish this. Slay these leeches upon our star... Kill them all. <cough> Kill...Zurvan!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: We must needs withdraw and prepare our assault. At the cost of his very life, the legatus hath prised open for us a window of opportunity.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: If you are prepared to enter Azys Lla's core, simply approach the verification node.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Have you lost your way, Warrior of Light? The path to Azys Lla's core can be opened with the verification node near the portal.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to Central Azys Lla?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Leave Central Azys Lla?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I had thought Regula a cold and ruthless man, but he showed surprising compassion for his soldiers.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And it also seems he placed great trust in his emperor. If Regula could be convinced that the technology for containing primals is fatally flawed, then mayhap Varis can be convinced as well.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: 'Tis not often that I dare approach so closely to entities such as Zurvan. How sharply am I reminded of the burden we place upon those whom are blessed with the Echo...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: These wounded soldiers will live, but further battle is beyond them. I have counseled them to remain here until their compatriots arrive to bear them home.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIERONE02394
dialogue.text: Forgive me if I show little gratitude for my rescue...

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIERONE02394
dialogue.text: It is said that the Emperor and van Hydrus were childhood friends. Foul fortune that we should be the ones to bring news of his death...

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIERTWO02394
dialogue.text: The research facility crawls with Zurvan's faithful, and they will not cease in their efforts to rouse him. If you would honor the legatus's sacrifice, then you must slaughter those fiends to the last.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: He's dead. Had I only been stronger...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Enough of that! There'll be time for regrets after we've rid the world of Zurvan!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Krile has the right of it. The Demon has fallen back into torpor for now, but we must act swiftly if Regula's death is to have meaning.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The survivors speak of an army of thralls loose in the facility, and we must assume that these followers continue their efforts to awaken the eikon.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Let us then concentrate upon diverting them from their task. Mistress Krile and Master Unukalhai, prithee secure the controls to Zurvan's shackles and limit the restoration of his might.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Archon Y'shtola and I shall forge ahead, and strike down those thralls as would seek to harry you.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Warrior of Light, thine is, as ever, the most perilous duty...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Gather to thee thy trusted companions, and extinguish from this realm the fires of the Demon himself.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The last pillar of the Warring Triad is set to fall! Let's see this to the end, Forename.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text:
The legatus spoke truly...
The thick of battle is no place to question oneself, and I will accept any forthcoming duty with certitude or not at all.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIERONE02394
dialogue.text: We will bear the legatus's remains back to Garlemald. His favored blade was shattered, but may your own weapon claim vengeance in its stead!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIERTWO02394
dialogue.text: When I volunteered for this mission, it was in the knowledge that my death would serve a greater purpose. We fell too quickly... Too quickly...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Incredible as always, Forename! Hopefully that will be the last our world sees of the likes of Zurvan.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Every one of his thralls has been slain as far as we can determine. Our victory over the Warring Triad is complete.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: ...An impossible feat had we not been blessed with your cooperation.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Let us not forget the efforts of Regula van Hydrus and his men. Without their noble sacrifice, the Demon would have awoken far sooner, and possessed of far more formidable energies.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The bodies of the fallen now accompany the survivors on the return journey to Garlemald. 'Tis known that the imperials recognize no god, yet they would honor the dead in their own fashion.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And when next we meet, our fleeting alliance will surely be forgotten. 'Twas an interesting exchange, nonetheless.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: They spoke of their present ruler as a man who values self-sufficiency. Varis befriended Regula in their youth, it seems, and was highly impressed by his martial prowess. 'Tis common knowledge that Regula's rise to legatus was in great part advocated by the Emperor himself.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Regula freely admitted his shortcomings when it came to politics, and it was Varis's unconditional support that served to win his undying fealty. One does not expect such tales of comradeship to lurk beneath the Empire's iron exterior...

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Contrary to all expectations, the man died a hero. Witnessing the way you all leapt into danger without hesitation, it would seem I am surrounded by heroes...

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: And yet, my own actions were aught but heroic. I have not the qualities nor the character to stand at the Warrior of Light's side.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: What a curious thing to say. Are you truly concerned that you do not measure up to some arbitrary requirement?

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: If you knew of the path I walked to reach this place, then you would understand why I doubt myself so. Return with me to the Rising Stones...and I shall tell you of it.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: With your victory over Zurvan, the Warring Triad is finally defeated. I am afraid, however, that mine own efforts have often been more hindrance than help... And you and your fellow Scions deserve to hear the reasons behind my actions.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: I promised to tell you of my journey. Of who I am. Of where I am from.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: The truth is, I am not of this world.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: I was born of a different star─a child whose power of the Echo was too feeble to save his dying world...

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: A child, who, unlike you, never became a Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: When all I knew stood on the brink of destruction, I was yet half-grown. Had I been born but a handful of years earlier, history may have written a different tale; the seeds of other heroes that had yet to fully sprout may not have withered and perished.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: The star I failed to save is known to you now as “the void.”

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Though Forename knew not that I spoke of my homeland, I have explained to herhim before the cause of its ruin. A magick was devised to contain a defeated primal's might within a stone known as “auracite.” And the energies which bled from this imperfect vessel gradually corrupted the champions who wielded it.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: These heroes became slaves to an insatiable hunger for aether, eventually transforming into hideous fiends. And none who clung to the faint traces of Light were strong enough to oppose them.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: The demons next turned upon each other in a war which drained the land's aether in ever greater amounts, until one day the star was suddenly swallowed in a flood of Darkness. An entire world unmade in an instant.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: The voidsent you encounter here in this realm are the twisted remnants of once-mortal beings who gnaw on what motes of life force remain...

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: And as I lay dying, beaten and broken in my failed last stand, 'twas a white-robed Ascian who found my tormented spirit and bore me away to the rift betwixt worlds. Elidibus has been my master ever since.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: And as I lay dying, beaten and broken in my failed last stand, 'twas my present master who found my tormented spirit and bore me away to the rift betwixt worlds. 'Twas he who first introduced me to Urianger.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: At my mentor's feet did I learn of the nature of reality: of the existence of mirrored worlds and the eternal struggle between Dark and Light.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Sudden and overwhelming superiority for either side will shatter the balance, and the world in question will be returned to the void by a calamity beyond imagining.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: As the self-appointed custodian of this balance, my master warned me that the Source─the first of all worlds─slips perilously close to oblivion.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: In what spirit did this master proffer such a warning? A benevolent gesture? Or veiled threat?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: To these questions and more do I mean to coax forth answers. Yet no matter his intention, that Hydaelyn doth teeter on a knife's edge is an undeniable truth. Knowing this, what choice was given you to make?

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: I chose to join my master, and act as his instrument on this star. The tragedy that befell my home cannot be repeated─I will see this world saved.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: ...And yet I hesitated at the most crucial of moments. What right have I to stand alongside a true Warrior of Light?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: In thine own words thou wert called before thy time, and I offer that thou dwellest overmuch on the question of what maketh the hero. The search for the answer leaveth thee paralyzed by doubt.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Heed me, Master Unukalhai: thou needest not believe thyself a hero to perform great deeds. 'Tis the deed itself which earneth thee the hero's mantle.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Aye, the ideals you hold can be less important than having the faith to act upon them. Regula's loyalty to the Emperor guided his actions until the last, and though we did not see eye to eye on many things, his final deeds can be called naught less than heroic.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Personally, I find that faith in my companions allows me to act unhindered by uncertainty.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I know that should I ever falter, Forename and the others will be there to support me...or steer me back onto the right path if needed.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: I see...

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: In the days leading up to my world's destruction, I was entirely alone. I never knew what it was to have such comrades...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I cannot imagine the loneliness you must have felt. But look around you now, Unukalhai...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You're not alone anymore.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Welcome to the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: I will fulfill my promise to save this world. And when I stumble, I shall be glad to have your hands there to steady me.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: My apologies. This is difficult for me. For so long have I spoken from behind a mask...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: We should all feel comfortable speaking without such concealments.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I should hope you appreciate the irony of that statement, Urianger...
